assessments.status_rationale: Today’s bullets contain no indication of a U.S. proclamation/USTR/Federal Register action imposing a new (or additional) 25% tariff on South Korean-origin passenger vehicles (HS 8703), nor any related effective date.
No item reports South Korea announcing retaliatory trade measures targeting U.S.-origin goods with stated coverage ≥ $2.0B.
No news bullet mentions USA Rare Earth or any additional U.S. federal financing commitment ≥ $200M beyond the already-disclosed Commerce equity stake.
There is no reference to CMS finalizing the Medicare Advantage Rate Announcement for contract year 2027, nor any published estimated average revenue change figure.
No bullet indicates CoreWeave has publicly filed a non-confidential S-1 registration statement for a U.S. IPO.
No item reports Microsoft announcing Maia 200 (second-generation Maia) availability to external Azure customers as a named VM/instance offering (preview or GA).

While multiple items discuss FAA failures and aviation safety oversight, none mentions the FAA publishing a specific modernization/safety implementation plan document containing at least three dated (month+year) milestones.
No bullet reports a new DoD/DARPA public solicitation (BAA/RFI/funding opportunity) explicitly seeking quantum sensing for navigation/timing with stated total program funding ≥ $50M.

Although UnitedHealth and other insurers are discussed (e.g., revenue decline expectations and sector selloff), the bullets do not show any major insurer publicly quantifying a 2027 Medicare Advantage policy-driven headwind ≥ $500M to annualized revenue and/or operating profit.
